markdownRemark.html:
Keris Nagasasra II pusaka miliki dari Raden Adipati Aria Surinagara (Kusumadinata IX atau Pangeran Kornel). Namanya Keris Nagasasra II ini senjata kebesaran Pangeran Kusumaadinata IX atau Pangeran Kornel. Wujudnya sangat elegan menambah kegagahan, kejayaan, ketangguhan dan kewibawaan, kharisma serta ucapannya sakti dari Pangeran Kusumadinata IX atau Pangeran Kornel. Warangka Keris yang artistik, badan keris yang bermotif ukiran Ular Naga utuh dilengkapi dengan motif rangkaian daun dan bunga menambah keagungan keindahan dari Sang Nagasasra II.

Pangeran Kusumadinata IX atau Pangeran Kornel telah menunjukan pribadi yang tangguh, gagah, berani, dan tendeng ludeng berhadapan dengan Gubernur Jenderal Daendels. Keris Ki Dukun yang dibawa pada peristiwa Cadas pangeran sebagai senjata tamengnya, keris Nagasasra II adalah hak milik pusakanya. Dua kekuatan Tanjeg Keris menyatu waktu itu. Kebesaran dan kejayaan dari pendahulunya menjadi pijakan dari Sang Pemilik Keris.

frontmatter.title: Keris Nagasasra II
frontmatter.textEnglish: The heirloom of the Nagasasra Keris II belongs to Raden Adipati Aria Surinagara (Kusumadinata IX or Prince Kornel). This keris was carried and held when Prince Kusumadinata IX faced and shook hands with Governor General Daendels (1811). Keris Nagasasra II is a witness to the history of Prince Kornel in defending the people of Sumedang to make the Post weigh Cadas Prince way. The Nagasasra II Keris is preserved and becomes an icon of the heirloom of the Sumedang Larang Palace. We should be proud of Adipati Surianagara  and his keris.

frontmatter.title: Keris Nagasasra I
frontmatter.textEnglish: The Nagasasra Keris I is a heirloom left by Rangga Gempol, the Regent of Sumedang who ruled from 1656 - 1706. It has high artistic value, is carved and has ornaments similar to a dragon's snake complete with a tail and head emblazoned on the body of the Nagasasra I dagger. The Nagasasra I Keris is an icon of Sumedang Larang Palace, heirlooms stored in the Sumedang Larang Palace heritage building. We should be amazed and proud of the legacy of the ancestors of the Sumedang Larang Palace

frontmatter.title: Keris Panunggul Naga
frontmatter.textEnglish: The Panunggul Naga keris, whose name is the dragon's arm, contains a noble and  the great meaning is the legacy of Ratu Pucuk Umun to his son, Prabu Geusan Ulun. The Panunggul Naga Keris has a distinctive shape inlaid with gemstones decorated with beautiful floral motifs, adding to the majesty and beauty of the keris. The Panunggul Naga Keris is one of the icons from the heirloom of the Sumedang Larang Palace. Now its  stored in the Heirloom building of the Sumedang Larang palace as the majesty, glory, valor of the Sumedang Larang palace.
